Reviews.Content: Now, I don't have to worry about my DLR getting wet.  Pictures quality are ok. not the greatest for this LUmix

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin O'Connell
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a while now and I love it. Works great in the water without the waterproof case and works great with the waterproof case for deeper dives.

Reviews.Title: I recommend this camera.
Reviews.Author: Chareen
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Takes beautiful pictures. I use it in the pool and at the water park and have had no issues with the water proof features. I also use this as general and keep it handy for times when running and getting my SLR isn't practical. Connecting to the Wi-Fi is very easy with my Samsung stratosphere II. I am more than satisfied, even recommended to a good friend before they went on a snorkeling vacation.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5 nice but a few changes suggested
Reviews.Author: Narcisa M. Droste "grillmania"
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift to my husband whose hobby is photography.  Mostly he likes his SLR cameras which he has used all over the world.  On our last trip to Playa del Carmen when he snorkeled with turtles, he did not have an underwater camera and lost a lot of good shots, so I bought this one for him because of the Leica Lens.  His attempt to connect to Windows8 and his Apple Tablet has not worked successfully, everything else has worked.  The one thing I would add for the benefit of Panasonic would be to add in the next version, some kind of adapter accessory to make it similar to GoPro where it can be easily attached instead of just slipping it around the hand (easily lost).

Reviews.Title: Rugged effective GPS camera
Reviews.Author: Mohamad Hussein
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures for a portable, thought point and shoot. GPS after the updates world's very well. The addition of places names for pictures taken while the whole the GPS is attempting to log on is a bit and miss. Overall love the camera and quality. It's a shame panasonic is getting out of cameras! Especially rugged ones

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, comfortable to hold
Reviews.Author: TBMaryland
Reviews.Content: Has all the bells and whistles of a modern point and shoot and lots of the extras if you want to dabble in more "manual like" settings. Great flash. Great size. Easy to get memory card in and out for downloading pics.

Reviews.Title: Simply Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Cottin's
Reviews.Content: Perfect size, great pictures and all the features you could want in a point and shoot camera.  Very simple to use to!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for travel and outdoor activities
Reviews.Author: Hoser1138
Reviews.Content: Great camera, takes wonderful photos, and the built-in wifi works well for sharing photos on the go, without need for a computer (I transfer them to a smartphone then upload wherever). The only downside to this camera is that the display screen can't be shut off, so it can drain the battery if you always leave it on between shots.

Reviews.Title: replacement of an older lumix
Reviews.Author: Keun-young Anthony Kim
Reviews.Content: I bought the older Lumix camera 2 years ago and used it in Hawaii.  We took pictures of underwater turtles and tropical fish.  Two years later, i noticed the camera would have issues with the screen and saving pictures.  It turns out water was leaking into the camera.  I've tried GoPro and Samsung but I think this camera provides the best < 40 feet underwater pics.One sad thing is the condensation that can build on the lens / view finder.  It can ruin a picture.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and build quality for a weather proof camera
Reviews.Author: J. Yao "kroq1067"
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best on the market for the feature and price. I've owned three different Panasonic ZS series cameras, for it's suprior image quality and LCD pixel count, as well as the wide angle / 20x optical zoom combo.  Took it to the mountains and put this camera to abuse in two separate heavy snow storms, and glad I did as I was able to capture the thrill of the kids snowboarding and snow play extensively. Every time the snow/water wipes right off the exterior lens without leaving marks in harsh environment.  I'm pleasantly surprised at the comaparable image quality from the TS5, given that Panasonic has to pack everything into a waterproof casing and make it as robust as it is. To sum up the perfect balance of durability and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: nhu
Reviews.Content: I got this camera with the best deal and I sastified this one. The camera have a lot of functions (wifi, GPS..) that I want and easy to use on my travelling! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent compact camera.
Reviews.Author: SHAUN BRYANT
Reviews.Content: This is my third Lumix camera, the others were fantastic too, but they all broke over time from hard usage. This camera takes great pictures and videos, period. I love it!

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: Jim J. Smith
Reviews.Content: Got this camera "free" using air mile points.  Wanted an underwater camera and this one is a do everything camera plus more.  The features in such a small unit is mind boggling technology.  The only issue is getting the wifi to work.  There are so many options it is difficult to follow even though there are separate instructions for it.  I have a mac air.  I found that some of the reviewers provided excellent advice on how they set it up.  THANKS.  Did snorkelling in Grand Cayman and was impressed.  Off to Cuba to do more snorkelling and this camera will do it all.  Just bought the extra battery packs and the float for the camera.  25bucks onAmazon.com but over 60 on Amazon.ca - fyi.  The one review said you need a float and he is absolutely right.  Didn't have one in Grand Cayman and I can see how one could drop it beyond reach just snorkelling.  Thank you Panasonic. Have to add - was on a cruise that stopped in Grand Cayman so when I downloaded the pics with GPS one could actually see where I took pics on the cruise off the coast and also where I was snorkelling.  Impressed my friends and blew me away.  jim

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: daryl
Reviews.Content: Great camera tough durable arrived fast battery last a long time great underwater pics along with Lo-light pics great deal for the price

Reviews.Title: Annoying messages
Reviews.Author: Greg Madsen
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is good quality. I use it to do prebuyer home inspections, so I take lots of photos. The zoom is limited over the standard camera from Panasonic . Every time I open the  side compartment to load  a disc  the underwater message come on. Another challenge is the location of the video button. It is too easy to hit it while trying to hit the shutter release button

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: David C. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Nice job on this camera.  It have the Leica made by panasonsic and this lumix is right there with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Tacee
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, love the fact I can connect it to my phone and use my phone as a remote. Haven't been able to use it underwater, but it passed all of the prelim underwater testing. Excited to use it on my up coming vacation.

Reviews.Title: Super Cam
Reviews.Author: Jeff "bluejlw"
Reviews.Content: This cam is one of the best cams I've owned.  I am an avid photographer and this is a kick butt back up cam.  It's slightly pricey but money well spent.

Reviews.Title: The best waterproof camera on the market.
Reviews.Author: Borocay
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation to Cancun and it worked great.  The pictures were clear and the 1080p video at 60fps was excellent.  It does go through batteries fast if using GPS, so I turned it off.  I also turned off the auto focus when taking video because it does make a slight clicking noise.  Other than that this camera rocks.  A+++++++

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot.  Buttons are a little small for my XL hands.  Uses batteries and memory fast, so need extra memory cards and ba
Reviews.Author: Brian K. Sauer
Reviews.Content: I would buy it again.  Takes good pictures.  The panoramic function is primo!.  I like the special button on top just for video.  Takes some time to get used to like most electronics.  Close up shots are primo too.  I recommend the "must have accessory kit for Panisonic Lumix"

Reviews.Title: Love this thing
Reviews.Author: moosel
Reviews.Content: I used this on a dive trip for photos and video, it worked great, certainly waterproof, I free dove down to 30+ feet repeatedly with no issues, a larger camera would have been a huge hindrance as I was breath-hold diving, this worked great.  My only complaint is that you need to take the camera off the default video setting to ensure that the video is easily played on your device rather than from the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: April C.
Reviews.Content: i have not tried it underwater yet, however, so far it works great! it takes awesome pictures even when taking out pictures of forest areas because its usually hard to get the pictures with good details, and  i got details, so im loving it! im just a bit frighten to go underwater with it LOL! but i soon i will

Reviews.Title: All the features you need
Reviews.Author: Tony Barre
Reviews.Content: Water proof, shock proof. Wifi connection to your cell phone, tablet, TV. Easy to use. Few buttons but many adjustments intelligently layered

Reviews.Title: Very Practical Camera
Reviews.Author: Pinakin Patel
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera. Took some great pictures.I would not recommend this camera as all purpose camera (not good enough for zooming to take wild life pictures). Worked well underwater, haven't seen the results yet b/c just got back from my trip to Costa Rica.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, don't be fooled by the Megapixels
Reviews.Author: Dane McGregor
Reviews.Content: Basically, a good camera for what it is-- I've taken it snorkeling, river rafting, zip lining, into snow, even into the Dead Sea without problem.BUT-- don't be fooled by the 16.1 Megapixel sensor size. It does in fact shoot images that large (4608x3456 pixels), but then it compresses the images so severely (presumably in order to fit more of them onto a memory card) that you can't really blow them up larger than you would, say, an 8MP image. It only shoots JPEG, not RAW or TIF or DNG, alas. If you look at an image full size, it has a great deal of JPEG artifacting and soft, featureless expanses of homogenous color.This could be fixed with a firmware update by Panasonic, but I'm not holding my breath...Additional usage warning: I bought this camera to replace an earlier Lumix Tough Digital Camera that was killed by the Colorado River. The silt in the Colorado is so fine that it gets into EVERYTHING, even the sealed buttons on the camera. Maybe this model is better sealed, maybe not, (I'm not willing to test it!) but just be aware that it might be an issue, and rinse THOROUGHLY after any immersion in water with fine silt.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: JM from Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: It is one of the best waterproof cameras out there in the market right now. The quality of the pictures is really good. Battery life could be a little better but I will just buy a second battery.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: anthony albanese
Reviews.Content: Takes fast pictures while moving and no blurry photos. Its perfect for the type of work I do. Great price too.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera!
Reviews.Author: MDami
Reviews.Content: Great camera, worked well in the water scuba diving and the photo quality is really nice! Great all around camera for traveling so you don't have to worry about it dropping and breaking. I got some great shots in the ocean that I wouldn't have ever thought of getting because I never had a tough camera like this. Easy to use as well.

Reviews.Title: best camera I have ever owned. surprisingly high quality.
Reviews.Author: Joseph cohen
Reviews.Content: exceeded every expectation. excellent value and quality.  takes great pictures and more. Give up your sur this is better and more fun.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: For now i think the camera is great. I didnt have a chance yet to try take pictures under water, which i hope from teh reviews i read about it will be all great. It surely takes great pictures and movies in teh landscaping, and everywhere else. I really like this camera and would recommend to anyone. It's small fits anywhere.As always its nice to purchase from Amazon, no problems, quick on time.

Reviews.Title: Best Amphibious Camera?
Reviews.Author: -G.
Reviews.Content: Picture quality excellent but it won't (As any other camera I seen of it's type shoot Raw images) Service depth rated for 43 ft. I've taken it down to that depth with no problems. Battery life excellent. HDR and Panorama mode work great. This camera lives with me in Canoe. In truck, at parties, everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Francisco Paolo Ferrara
Reviews.Content: I wanted a "tough" camera for a trip we recently took and I chose this one based on consumer reports. I must say I am really happy with the pictures it took. I did use it while in the pool with no problem, but I did not drop it to see how that was. Great camera!We just bought the Lumix TS5 after we saw the awesome pictures our friends took with their TS3. And, so far, we love the camera as well. It takes very good pictures. We have not taken the camera snorkeling, but did take some underwater pictures in the pool. After the first moments of doubt, it did deliver and we got some funny shots. We love the GPS recognition it has, to remember where we took the shots. It is a great pocketsize all-arounder

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Author: maylene wagener
Reviews.Content: this Camera is exactly what I needed for my trip.  been able to take lots of cool pics under water.  easy to use

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Edu
Reviews.Content: It' s all that I expected.It' s a shame though, that it doesn't even ships with a tiny sd card.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, could be better, but I rate it as 9
Reviews.Author: Benjamín Peña Camacho
Reviews.Content: It is a very good rugged camera.As pros:- Timelapse shots is a pretty feature, because you can make timelapses on outsides with out fear of wheater.- Good color and definition.- Manual mode is pretty useful.- And the macro is pretty cool, because you can make photos with flash easily and it helps to shots.As Contra:- I think the megapixels should be smaller, because the pictures in the biggest shots shows some noise and you can note the correction at isos up 100.- Should be good that you can shot pictures while you are filming videos.- I am afraid about warranty with panasonic, when water get in the camara, because in anothers reviews I have read someone has happend.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5
Reviews.Author: Baker
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera for both underwater and above water.  The intelligent auto feature captures sunsets that other cameras cannot.  I used this camera for 7 snorkeling excursions in the Caribbean and it performed flawlessly.  Be aware that there are limitations to taking pictures that are too far from the camera like sunken ships and distant seascapes, these may appear with a strong bluish cast.  A bluish tint may also occur when shooting pictures without much natural sun light (i.e., in heave cloud cover).  Also, pictures can be overexposed when using the Beach setting if there is too much sun reflecting off light colored corral background or white sand.  Love this little camera.  I upgraded it from a TS2.  I can attest to the shockproof claim as well as I fell on a rocky beach and my camera bounced off the rocks with barely a scratch whereas my body is black and blue.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size, great pixel count and more
Reviews.Author: Jimmy R. Hammond
Reviews.Content: First in-water pictures were great and next test is Nepal base camp, can't wait! Wifi is a real bonus, pictures are on the way ASAP!

Reviews.Title: can u say parrot fish
Reviews.Author: G. Bowman
Reviews.Content: this camera worked great on our trip to aruba.took great regular as well as underwater pictures.this camera went underwater 10 times over a 2 week time with out any problems.i charged the battery 3 times (which means i had to open the comp.that the sd & battery is.no problems with water.) i also made a few short 5 min, videos with the camera. they looked fine for underwater.i did notice in some of the reviews that people complained about clicking and snaping noises while videoing underwater. first what did they expect to hear anyways.2nd,  i did notice these types of sounds while underwater...not sure but i think it was parrot fish eating coral.i did hear that a lot.all in all, i recomend this camera to anyone

Reviews.Title: Great water-proof point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: movie streamer
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to New Zealand, went glacier hiking, funyaking, jet boating and an overnight cruise in Milford Sound. We were impressed with both picture and video quality, ease of use and portability. Battery life was great for pictures and adequate for a few short videos. The camera has a panorama mode which was a nice bonus. We did not ever take the camera underwater but it had no issue getting wet.Obviously there are limitations with a point and shoot - the video is a bit jittery when the camera moves a lot. Also, it takes 1-2 seconds for the camera to save the shot even with high-speed SD cards. However, it is still a great buy for the money and earns 5 stars.If you do take video with it, consider changing the default video setting. AVCHD is not compatible with iPhoto on a recent Mac (1 year old) and by default the video is interlaced which makes conversion a little tricky. VLC is able to play the files (MTS) but doesn't seem to do as well and you have to turn on deinterlacing. Had no issue on a PC (video was also deinterlaced automatically in Media Player).

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: david chappell
Reviews.Content: This is such a great camera.  It has so many features that I'm still having fun learning.  Clear pictures, wifi (love it) and many more.  The only thing that is negative about it is the screen has no protection from getting scratched.

Reviews.Title: Disaapointed with 60fps options, manual exposure mode and time lapse
Reviews.Author: B. Herder "YouTube: bradtube1"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for 2 days and I'm very disappointed.I have a TS3 and I've been very happy with it.  I bought this camera because it had 3 new things I really wanted:1. HD Movies at 1080p/60fps and 720p/60fps.2. Manual Exposure Mode3. Time LapseAnd, I'm disappointed with all 3 features.You can read below why or you can view this video: http://youtu.be/ddRL5ROW_2g60fps Movies:If you choose MP4, all your movie frame rates are 30fps. If I choose AVCHD, all whole bunch of 60fps options are available.If I record in AVCHD and download to a PC, no problem. If I try to import AVCHD to my MAC where I do all my movie editing, iMovie and iPhoto both don't seem to be able to import them.  Very disappointing.  I know - maybe this is Apple's problem, not Panasonic's but if they had those frame rates for the MP4 format, it wouldn't be a problem.Manual Exposure Mode:You only have two choices for aperture: F3.3 and F10, that's it.  And you don't have any choice of shutter speed.  You can choose +/- 1/3 EV, +/- 2/3 EV and +/- 1 EV.  And when you take a picture, it takes 3.  One at 0EV, and one darker and one lighter.  Dumb, dumb, dumb.  This shouldn't be called Manual Exposure mode.  I'll never use this.Time Lapse:I had a hard time finding it.  I would have thought it would be a mode on the camera, but it's hidden on page 4/5 in the setup menu.  You get to choose a shooting interval (10s, 20s, up to 1 min, then 2 min, 3 min up to 30 min) and you get to choose how many shots it will take with the maximum being 1000.  At 30fps, that means, you can only take 33 seconds of video... It actually doesn't make this into a video, it just takes individual pictures and you have to assemble them into a video.  An old Canon I had made a real video.  My old Canon could go down to .5 second (1/2 second) intervals and that was perfect for time lapse of construction workers doing something.  10 seconds is WAAAAAAAYYYYYY TOOOOOO LONG.  And 1000 pictures is way too few.  Maybe not for clouds going overhead, but for what I wanted it for.Such a disappointment.The camera does take great pictures and video, but every single reason I upgraded from the TS3 isn't working or isn't what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Nader Atout
Reviews.Content: Really good. I love it. I really recommend it to any one. I tied it in normal and salt water. Great pictures. I also tried it in 10 meters diving trip.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.  Bad Software
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the Lumix Tough series of digital cameras.  Short of professional-grade equipment, they're the best cameras for going snorkeling/hiking/camping with.  The GPS/compass/barometer features are great.  I love being able to see where I took pictures later on.  Also I've used these line of cameras for years without any problems.Pros:* great screen* great picture quality* very ruggedThe cons:* slow software.  cycling through pictures or zooming in on them can take a long time (multiple seconds between button pushes and screen updates).  this wasn't an issue on my DMC-TS4 (it's predecessor)* the wifi link software is lame... like most software hardware manufacturers write (with the exception of Apple).

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: massimiliano
Reviews.Content: exactly correspondent to my expectancies. it is water resistent and the quality of pictures and movies is very high. the LEICA optic is  great.

Reviews.Title: Super complete camera
Reviews.Author: Wbadra
Reviews.Content: Is makes fast  and very good shots. I tested it a lot under the water and it works perfectly. I am just having difficulty with the NFC system, I just succeeded to connect it using wireless, not with a single touch as promised

Reviews.Title: Great "Tough" point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Victor Skulavik
Reviews.Content: Always wanted a camera that we could take on vacation and not have to treat it like a delicate flower.  We took it on vacation: sand, surf, boating, snorkeling, swimming pools, rain, hiking, car traveling out-the-window shots. We took over 2000 pictures/videos. Couldn't think of a better test for this rugged camera. I couldn't do that with my other camera. Easy enough for my whole family to operate without taking a course to learn to operate it! Still reviewing the pics! I'm not a professional photographer, and I haven't had time to even load the advance features software yet, but I'm already very satisfied. Anything that I'll learn from here on out is a Plus!

Reviews.Title: This camera is alot of fun!
Reviews.Author: wade eaty
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our trip to the beach, wanting something we wouldn't have to worry about near the water. We were pleasantly surprised at the under water picture quality.  The gps function is a nice added little feature. When its on it tells you exactly where the picture was taken. Great little camera. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: A camera for us motorcycle nuts!
Reviews.Author: kenneth
Reviews.Content: I have 7 different cameras I purchased for use on my bike rides and this is the best one of them all. Easy to use while riding and very good pictures as well as video. Start up is very fast from the on-off button which I need. I had the lumix TS-1 and it was slow to start up but was so easy to use on the bike I excepted that one flaw in the camera. The only reason Im not using the TS-1 anymore is my daughter took it for her bike - Im happy she did. This TS-5 starts and goes! I don't need all the tech stuff that this camera has but if you like or need the GPS, compus, wi-fi and more it's got it all.  I need the tuffness of this camera. I ride alot and get caught in some heavy rain at times so the waterproofing is wonderfil and the shockproofing is the best I have ever seen for the open road.I've got the Go-Pro, Drift HD-170, Stelth HD and some others but this is the best one of them all for me.One other thing. I also purchased extra batteries when I ordered the camera but I get an all day ride with the one that came with the unit. However, if I need extra batteries I've got them.  Hope this helps someone looking for a good camera for the road.Ride Safe!

Reviews.Title: Would recommend but it has some drawbacks
Reviews.Author: HighFive
Reviews.Content: I owned an earlier TS3 model and liked the features and usability so much I waited to buy the TS5. Every time the seal for the battery/sd card compartment is opened, you risk letting in debris which could cause failure. I was extremely excited to use the new wifi features as I hoped they would limit the number of times the camera needs to be opened. The wifi features include sending pictures to an Android device (and maybe more) and using the Android device as a viewfinder and remote trigger. These features are great when they work. Unfortunately, connecting to the camera is difficult and requires me to attempt multiple times most likely due to my phone looking for a wifi signal. The best method for connecting to favorite devices that I have found is as follows: Turn off wifi on device. Turn on camera's wifi. Enter Pin (password for camera's wifi). Click favorite connections. When the camera is looking for the connection, open the app on the device. Turn on wifi on device. Go back to App quickly before it can connect anywhere. Hit refresh until you see the TS5 connection. Click on the TS5 connection and you should be connected. If you don't see the TS5 connection, turn off the wifi, turn it back on and refresh the app again.Once connected the remote shutter works great. just put the camera on a tripod and snap away with your smartphone; no camera shake! When going for hikes, I can set the camera up walk to where it is pointing, and line myself up for a picture. When ready snap away again.The other feature that makes this camera stand out is the weather proofing. I bought this to go places my cell phone cannot go. Rainy hikes, pool days, skiing, beach days, etc are the types of places I will bring this camera and if performance is anything like the TS-3 model, I will be very happy.GPS - I love this feature. It Geo tags the photos so you can relive your vacation and see where you were! While connected to the GPS satilites, the camera shows your coordinates and altitude. Great for hikes. If you know the height of a stop point, just track your progress on the camera.Dark pictures - I have found using the built in HDR mode and the Starry sky mode produce the best dark/night photos. Starry sky has a shutter time of 15 or 30 seconds (plus processing time) and grabs all light from the area.I have not had it very long yet so I can not comment on its durability, or how well the seals hold up. The TS-3 died in 18 months but this camera has been redesigned so I am hopeful for longer life. The great pictures and features of the TS-3 made me give Panasonic another chance.I have a couple more minor complaints:Battery - Seems to die somewhat faster the the older model. It lasts for a couple of hours of use. The camera is still very usable. I am only commenting because it was disappointing.difficult buttons - I find the buttons more difficult to push and spaced a bit too close. This is in no way a deal breaker though.I recommend this camera but be aware of the downfalls. It seems very well built, is easy to use (minus the wifi) and the pictures come out fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Not Water proof!
Reviews.Author: Tech Dad "T Daddy"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my vacation and invested in the expensive Marine case for Scuba dives and while the camera worked well in the case as soon as i walked into the ocean without the extra case just 5 feet deep it filled with water and died.If I knew this would only work with the $300 extra case I would have selected another camera..  But they claim it is waterproof in shallow water with no case.. that is NOT TRUE..

Reviews.Title: Great for family adventures
Reviews.Author: Devin E. Prouty
Reviews.Content: Just took this camera on a family backpacking trip along the CA coast.  It preformed great in many different conditions, beach, forest, direct sunlight, shade. the i auto  feature is great, just point and shoot and you get a good photo.  There are also a ton of setting for fun effects and full manual control of the camera.  The video quality is very good.  The battery lasted 5 days and about 300 photos.  I would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great Shooter, a bit heavier than some...
Reviews.Author: R. T. Proctor "Citynot4me"
Reviews.Content: Color balance seems great, fast start-up, and leica glass...all and all, great compact that's shockproof to boot. Replaces my Fuji, which went down from snorkeling too deep, The Lumix goes to 10meters+,, see how it holds up in the long run...

Reviews.Title: Warning!  Video is, difficult. lens noise ruins it. Otherwise, it's excellent
Reviews.Author: jazzmans
Reviews.Content: I must say, and Must emphasize,  Video is USELESS!  the noise from the camera lens auto-focusing is not constant, but frequent, and it overcomes any other audio, it sounds like a woodpecker rat-tat-tat-ing.  I'm very displeased with this, although other reviews had mentioned this fact. (edit feb 2014)  I use this camera all the time, it totally replaced my ZS-19, it's one heck of a camera, and I could only be happier if there wasn't lens motor noise in videos.  it'd definitely get a 5 star review from me if not for this fact. (end edit)Other then that, it does appear to take good pictures,  and the waterproof/dustproof will be really nice. I'm tired of having to replace a lumix zs series every six months or so due to dust in the lenses. I've owned six or so zs series over the last few years, and I really loved them, just need a more robust camera.Again,  if you plan to ever record ambient video with audio, DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA.I've had this camera over a month now,  it takes really good pictures, in most cases as good as the pictures my Lumix DMC-ZS19.  Battery life is as good as the ZS19,  as long as you remember to set up airplane mode.  (airplane mode turns OFF gps when the camera is off, otherwise GPS is always on)  A little annoying is that every time you open the door to remove the memory card or replace the battery, it reminds you to check and ensure the door is closed.It turns on very quickly, faster then the DMC series, which is really useful.The time lapse feature is excellent, and the 'hand held night shot' mode takes far better pictures then I'd ever expect it to, as is the starry night mode, in either 15second or 30second shutter.The noise in video is really unfortunate, as it takes quite good video at max resolution.I'll probably have to give up and buy a GoPro for my active videos, since Contour is out of business, and the new Sony doesn't record sound at most FPSAll in all, I'm very happy with this camera, and pull it out 99% of the time vs the DMC-ZS19,  due to its durability.

Reviews.Title: ¿Que? No English-language user guide? Nevertheless, a GREAT underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: Zoltan Korliss
Reviews.Content: Is Amazon selling grey-market goods? The Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5D (Orange) I received does not include an English language user manual. All package inserts are in Spanish and Portuguese. The default language setting on the camera is Spanish.I was able to find and download an English-language PDF manual online, which turned out to be only the "basic" manual. The basic manual refers users to the "advanced features" manual. I had to conduct another internet search to download the "advanced features" manual.I will update this review when I have tried the camera in an underwater setting, which is the reason I purchased it.UPDATE: AUGUST 2013After having the opportunity to use the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5D (Orange) underwater, I have raised my "star rating" for this camera from 2 stars (based on my disappointment at not receiving an English language user manual) to a full 5 stars based on underwater performance. I purchased the camera for underwater use at shallow snorkeling depths, and for that purpose it performs as well or better than I could have expected. The camera is durable and waterproof, and the underwater settings include the option to adjust the amount of underwater color correction, an option I have not previously seen on a waterproof point-n-shoot camera. An optional viewfinder setting allows the camera to automatically adjust viewfinder brightness relative to ambient lighting, resulting in better viewfinder visibility when submerged.

Reviews.Title: Great on my trip to the Philippines
Reviews.Author: Delicious
Reviews.Content: I wanted a durable camera, where I could take quick shots on the go.  This camera did the job great.  It handle the dirt and ocean of the rural area where my mom's village is located.  I took it out fishing and our boat accidentally capsized, but the camera was fine - and I got great pictures too.It also wasn't as big a target as more flashy camera's were, especially in a place were stuff like this gets snatched from tourists often.Cons:I wish the zoom was better, but it's still OK.While it can take night-time photo, it can't really shoot video in dark light.Additional:Maybe it's just the way I hold the camera, but I messed up a few pictures with accidentally having a finger in the way of the lens.  It's just awkward because most waterproof cameras have their lens in the same place, but it's the same spot that comfortable to place my left index finger.Overall I'm glad I got this camera and will be using it a whole bunch more!!

Reviews.Title: Poor Customer Service for comparatively expensive camera
Reviews.Author: leojsayta
Reviews.Content: This is my third Panasonic camera.  I've owned this camera for about 6 weeks and taken it on one extended trip.  The camera has never been dropped or used outside of its stated design parameters.  Despite my careful handling of this camera the top button on the dpad has become stuck, and no longer functions correctly.  I contacted customer support, and was told I would have to pay to send it in for repair, and that the repair process would likely take over 2 weeks.  I requested an advanced replacement (paying in advance for the new camera, and receiving a refund when Panasonic receives the original malfunctioning unit), and I was told that this was not an option.  I requested that Panasonic at least pay for shipping since the camera is nearly new, I am (but no longer) a loyal repeat Panasonic customer, the camera is about twice as expensive as its competition, and I have never requested service from Panasonic in the past.  I was told this was not possible either.  Panasonic does not seem very interested in maintaining customer loyalty.  I willing paid for the extra cost of this camera over its competition in the belief that I was getting a higher quality item with better customer service.  Unfortunately, that belief seems to be in error.  I would suggest to prospective purchasers of this camera that they purchase a less expensive alternative brand since this camera's higher price does not seem to net you much over the lower priced competition.Pros:-seems well built (aside from sticking button)-battery lasts much longer than the last generation-camera UI is mostly straightforward-gps photo tagging is great when the camera has a location fixCons:-each panasonic point and shoot model (including new generations of the same model) seems to use a different proprietary battery--- neither of the batteries from my other recent point and shoot Lumix cameras fit this model--- other people on my trip had new and older Lumix P&S; cameras and none of the batteries were interchangeable-to get a good photo you really need good light (and some luck)-for gps photo tagging to function correctly you need a location fix which can take up to several minutes (an eternity when you're worried about your batteries lasting for another 2 weeks)-wifi setup and usage is not intuitive-As far as I've been able to determine, the only way to charge the battery is to place it in the battery charging tray and plug it into AC current.  This is really annoying when you are one multi-day (week) trips and there is no outlet handy.  I haven't discovered any way to charge a battery via USB (either in or out of the camera).  This makes it impossible to recharge a battery from a powerpack or solar charger.  This is a pretty huge omission for a camera that is supposed to be designed with the wilderness in mind-***Extra Cost of the camera over the competition does not seem to result in increased reliability or better customer service***

Reviews.Title: Terrible autofocus noise spoils videos
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research to find the ideal waterproof digital camera which is capable of recording full hd video. I thought I had found it with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5.Unfortunately, I recognized a TERRIBLE AUTOFOCUS NOISE IN VIDEOS when I tried it out playing the video on my computer. The noise is so bad that I decided to return the camera. I don't want to spoil all videos to be taking in the future with such a noise.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: Do not buy!!!! Waste of Money READ HERE
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at my local electronics store and was looking forward to a decent camera for the price. This camera feels awkward when you hold it and the resolution is UNBELIEVABLY bad.Almost every time I even attempt to use the zoom feature, there is tons of distortion and the menu itself is hard to navigate!I couldn't figure out how to upload video, which was annoying and it takes an eternity just to try and change a setting for any part of the camera.Overall, my experience with this camera was horrible, which is why I took the time to find a QUALITY camera that will last and be friendly to use. Luckily, after searching for weeks, I finally settled on a camera I love! I have used it for just over a month now and the difference in picture quality and overall function is amazing.If you'd like to take a look at this camera GO HERE -------> http://amzn.to/1okZUPVIt is here on Amazon and you won't be dissappointed, I promise!

Reviews.Title: At first
Reviews.Author: thomas
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying this camera. lets be honest, whens the last time you saw a panasonic camera?? exactly! I was looking for a good camera. I was looking at the Nikon Aw110/120, Fuji xp200 and olympus tg 2. I wanted the tg 2 because it had the bells and whistles and the new tg 3 is coming out in june but thats 350 and i cant see much difference in specs between the tg 2 and panasonic. After doing hours of research i brought the panasonic. Its a large camera but it has to be. I took a few pics and etc and i really really like this thing. It has alot of features, takes really good pics and has a nice battery life. I havent tested it in the h2o.THE ONLY PAIN IN THE BUT IS you have to take the battery out the camera and plug it into the charger panasonic gives you that has to plug in the wall.like really panasonic? what year are we in? 2000?Other than that, i highly recommend this camera. Also buy accidental insurance from square trade. 3 years cost me like 40 bucks. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Hassan Farid
Reviews.Content: ordered as gift to a friend, they like it, was not hear anything bad about it, they ask for such a camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Great product and is exactly what I was looking for, came on time and as described. Easy to use and works great.

Reviews.Title: Great undeewater camera
Reviews.Author: kep59
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use on a recent trip to the Atlantis resort in the Bahamas.  I am so glad o did!  The camera took beautiful pictures both on and out of the water.  In fact the resort had people taking pictures in the water park that you could purchase using the same camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: It's a Good camera for the price, why? because it offers 16.1MP and the built quality is of great quality materials. I totally like it's design and all the features. It's a good back up camera for pro photographers as well. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Maramba
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, it's easy to use and pretty rugged.  I have dropped a few cameras and so far this one is holding up great!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gouillard JB
Reviews.Content: The camera is just as described. This is a great product from Lumix again, easy to use and nice pictures. Only "bad" point is that battery time is a bit short. GPS and wireless are battery eater!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Robin Christman
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! It is still pretty new but so far I really love it. Easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: S. J. Thiel
Reviews.Content: I love it- survived getting wet during a kayak trip. Very easy to use.  Wish it had a separate view finder vs. screen- hard to see in sunlight at times.  But wanted a camera I didn't have to worry when out on the water- this is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the Price and No Problems with it at all. Quick Simple and Solid Design makes it easy to use and transport.
Reviews.Author: Jesse J Shaffery
Reviews.Content: Great Product for the Price and No Problems with it at all. Quick Simple and Solid Design makes it easy to use and transport.

Reviews.Title: Decent specs, with some potentially serious flaws
Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: None of the tough/waterproof point and shoot cameras on the market today offer standout performance; each one has compromises.  Here are some of the key points for the TS5.1. Great intelligent auto mode - the iA mode is truly adept at selecting the right scene mode for the situation.2. Heavy handed noise reduction - all these tough/waterproof cameras seem to have strong noise reduction algorithms, but the TS5 seems to have the heaviest of the bunch.  This has the effect of waxy skin tones and loss of detail.3. Good and bad video qualities - 1080p at 60 fps takes silky smooth video.  But like many other reviewers have noted, there is a noticeable ticking sound generated by the camera in quieter environments.  Unacceptable!4. No Macintosh support!  Panasonic does not supply any Mac software to download photos/videos.  Also, AVCHD video is difficult to extract onto Macs.  60 fps is only available in the AVCHD format, negating the TS5's video quality advantage over its peers.5. Other peculiarities - NFC did not work with my Nexus 7 tablet.  The battery charger has a separate cord (really, in this day and age?).  The USB interface uses a proprietary interface, instead of the practically standard micro USB.In the end, this camera failed to deliver on what a point and shoot camera should be - easy to use with a minimum of work to extract useable photos and videos.  When my TS5 also came (new) with dead pixels on the display screen, it was an easy choice to return it.

Reviews.Title: Great, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on the extensive Wirecutter review, and completely agree with all their praise and minor niggles. I'd say it takes great auto pictures as long as it's not too dark, and if you have a tripod, it takes fantastic night pictures. has the cleanest high frame rate 1080p video i've ever seen in a point and shoot, but it pretty much sucks if you are in dark conditions. makes a faint sound when refocusing in video, but I don't find it to be distracting. as to durability, i've put it through it's paces and so far, so good. crazy good battery life on this thing, i've never had it run out.

Reviews.Title: Worked great down to 15 feet
Reviews.Author: taxman
Reviews.Content: Not sure it is what I need, maybe should have got a cheaper UW camera for specific uses and just relied on my other point and shoots. Disappointed with UW battery life and battery in general.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Q.H
Reviews.Content: The camera seems pretty decent so far.  I tested it by taking pictures in my saltwater reef tank; work well, no leak.  All the functions/buttons works fine under water.  Dropped the camera couple times and no issues also.However, somehow the package missing the usb cable to connect from the camera to pc.  will have to call them to ask about this.  so 3 stars for now.

Reviews.Title: Good camera GPS drains the battery.
Reviews.Author: M Sanders
Reviews.Content: The GPS doesn't turn itself off so you have to manually turn it on and off or have to charge your battery all the time. My old TS3 would go for days and never run out of juice.

Reviews.Title: Great quality pics and vids
Reviews.Author: JKLM
Reviews.Content: Still the best maker of waterproof, shockproof, etc cameras. Can't beat the quality of the pics and vids. The features have improved from the last DMC I had.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: John K.
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before buying and I was worried. However, it's been a great camera with no flaws.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Huff
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a few days before a trip to the keys.  I used it while snorkeling and did have any issues with it.  I have used it several time in the pool at home as well as in the mountains with my family and the pictures all come out great.  I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: this is my second
Reviews.Author: Astolfo "SailorGeek"
Reviews.Content: I lost the first one, and the CC insurance is paying for the replacement. the pictures are ok grainy at night or low light conditions, the movies have a ticking sound. to be honest I like my TS4 much better.I did not have enough time to fully asses the camera so I will update this review when I have more time once the replacement arrives.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam
Reviews.Author: Anuj Mishra
Reviews.Content: the weight is camera is much.. one disadvantage..otherwise image quality is at par with competitors. in built WiFi and editing features for novice as well as pro users.overall , well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Melissa Reyes
Reviews.Content: I wanted a "tough" camera for a trip we recently took and I chose this one based on consumer reports.  I must say I am really happy with the pictures it took.  I did use it while in the pool with no problem, but I did not drop it to see how that was.  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: great outdoor and underwater pictures for price
Reviews.Author: Edward A Cole
Reviews.Content: Had previous version that went bad after 2 years from seal.  Got this and pictures are just as good.  There is some noise on zooming on video but not that huge a deal for me for the good pictures it take. Use it boating, snorkeling scuba diving and tubing with great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Heike Moers "Heike"
Reviews.Content: We just bought the Lumix TS5 after we saw the awesome pictures our friends took with their TS3. And, so far, we love the camera as well. It takes very good pictures. We have not taken the camera snorkeling, but did take some underwater pictures in the pool. After the first moments of doubt, it did deliver and we got some funny shots. We love the GPS recognition it has, to remember where we took the shots. It is a great pocketsize all-arounder!

Reviews.Title: Nice device but average Low Light image quality
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I bought this model (FT5 for non-US market) a week ago.May be I am spoiled by my old DSLR (Canon 400D) but the very first thing I mentioned - very average image quality if you shoot your photo at low light conditions.Image is not "noisy" but very "grainy", those artifacts are easily visible if you do even 4X zoom right in-camera, let alone you do that on your computer.(Search on Flickr, I have uploaded a few examples). Unfortunately the camera believes that pretty much all indoor shoots to be a "low light" scenes.That happens probably because of high ISO the camera tries to setup at the first possible chance.Even shooting outdoor (it was quite cloudy there but anyway it was a late morning!) on tele the camera setup ISO of 320 which caused some noise/graininess to be noticeable. If you go with ISO 100-200 it is quite nice, however.Also very strange logic the camera utilizes - if I shoot a scene with flash (in a low light) - it setups ISO at 800 and make exposure around 1/60.But when I shoot the same scene without flash - exposure goes up to 1/2-1/4 (which is totally understandable) but the ISO goes down to 400!One additional thing to mention: a few days after I bought it, the camera started making some "clicking" noise when I took it in my hand and shake it gently.Like something is moving inside and bouncing back and forth. I asked Panasonic technical support and they said it was something that should be looked at.WiFi is clumsy and very odd - the camera cana) transfer images to your PC (upload files to smb share),b) upload pictures to your smartphone,c) upload pictures to web services like Flickr, Picasa, Facebook etc.d) Upload pictures to Panasonic's cloud storage server,e) be managed remotely from your smartphone,f) display pictures on an external AV device,g) print pictures on a printer,so seven functions in total. So far so good.Now guess - how many times you'll have to enter your WiFi settings (like an SSID if it is hidden for security purposes and encryption key) if you stay with the same network and decide to try all these nice features?If you say "one" - you are wrong. SEVEN TIMES! Yes, the password for your wifi network is a property of an "action" you choose so if you just entered your 20-symbols password to uploads photos to your computer and decided to upload a couple of them to your Facebook page straight from the camera - be ready to enter the password again. Very annoying.Luckily those settings could be saved and reused later but if you want to do the same цршду being connected to your friend's network - be prepared to repeat the all those steps again.Display image is good - nice and sharp, has auto back-light option so camera adjusts brightness of the screen automatically.Controls are relatively small and when you press those buttons - you cannot hear "click" or get good haptic feedback as in normal cameras.This is probably due to some level of toughness the camera provide, it feels unusual at the beginning but a few days later you get used to it.PROS:good design and feeling how it sits in your hands,good video quality,a lot of WiFi options (when you eventually go through that glitches I described above - it works),remote management over WiFi is a really nice feature,optical image stabilization does a good job,logically organized menu with descriptions to every optionCONS:low image quality at low light conditions - that is my primary complainsometimes visible distortions on a wide end if you shoot something that is closed to you.illogical WiFi settingsIt is difficult to compare with other competitors because I have not used them. Actually it is my first point-and-shoot camera after DSLR so this is why I may be so demanding about picture quality.However looking at photos that were taken from Olympus TG-2 and Nikon AW110 it looks like those chaps have (much) better photo quality, especially for indoor environment.

Reviews.Title: MOORE THAN EXPECTED
Reviews.Author: Jaime M.
Reviews.Content: MY FIRST LUMIX CAMERA WAS  FROM THE EARLY DIGITAL CAMERAS!!I USED SO MUCH THAT I DESTROYED  THE CAMERA!.ONE REAZON FOR BUYN THE CAMERA WAS THE  LEYCA LENS.THE BEST ,THIS LUMIX CAMERA IS REAL GOOD IM GETTING GREAT PICTURES AND WITH ALL THE NEW EXTRAS ,WATER  AND FALL RESISTANCE,,  UFF I LOV IT!!GREAT EXPECTATIONS!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but I haven't tested it under water yet.
Reviews.Author: Chrissy
Reviews.Content: We bought this to replace our canon power shot sd1300.  Overall, the camera is very user friendly, and durable so our 2 year old can handle it without worry.  Most of the photo options are available within a couple clicks, a few are hidden within the menu (multiple photos per second for example)  I have tried a few other photo options, but the best seems to be intelligent autofocus, which is the default setting on the camera.  Another feature that is really cool is the ability to take multiple photos per second.  I found the 5 frames per second to be very useful when taking photos of your dog or children who tend to move a bit.  I tried the sport setting for this and was disappointed in the photo quality; most movement photos showed blurr; maybe because the photos were taken inside.  The flash is good for inside photos in dimly lit rooms, but doesn't work as well in dark areas.Video quality is on par with our video camera.  There is also the option of super slow motion video, and 1080p, but if you plan on using that feature often I'd recommend a high performance SD card because the video takes longer to write to the card.  With lower performance SD cards it takes longer and some of the older cards can't even handle it at all.  I checked out about SD card performance on SDcard.org.  There is no reason to pay $100 for an SD card unless you are taking two hour videos in 1080p or something equivalent, but you need at least a SDHC(10) or better for hd video.  I have a SDHC 10 and I have to wait about 30 seconds or so after shooting video for the data to be fully written to the card.  This may be more of an issue to others but for me it was't a big deal.  Just know that it isn't the camera's fault.  Every camera has this issue.  It's the card's.Wi-fi sounds like a gimmick, but if you are taking this underwater, which we fully intend to do, it will be much safer to upload photos wirelessly, than risk water damage from opening the waterproof door to take the SD card out for uploading photos every time.  It can be a handy feature.  That becomes irrelevant when you still have to open the door to charge the battery, however.  So, until they come up with a way to charge the battery without opening the door WiFi is still just a gimmick to me.  I don't have a smart phone to test the NFC technology, but I can see where it could be useful to some people as long as they have a phone that is compatible.  If this is an important feature to you, it would be wise to check with Panasonic for a list of compatible phones to see if you can use this feature.  I bet the majority of people can't.I haven't been outside with the camera yet.  I haven't taken it under water yet.  I haven't dropped it on the ground or my tile floor yet.  I will update this after I have done so.

Reviews.Title: Meets all expectations.
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM S.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding camera.  Have used it over the Holidays with outstanding results.  Will give it its underwater test in Hawaii in March.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Vicki Price
Reviews.Content: We ordered this to visit Hawaii and snorkeling.  I love ordering from PRIME  it is well worth the money !

Reviews.Title: Panasonic had no "Image Application"  for Windows 8 Phones & Tablets; there's no ways to use the Remote Control function.
Reviews.Author: Peter Le
Reviews.Content: Please pay attention:Phones and tablets with Windows 8 Operating system have no ways to become what is called "Getting connected and change your smartphone or tablet into a remote control".  Panasonic has never built any "Image Applications" for Windows phones or tablets; that App. is needed for communicating between the camera and other handheld devices. Image Application is only available for Mac O.S and Android; Panasonic completely disregarded of Windows users.  How can it be with a global company? Why Panasonic didn't warn Windows users about this problem with  "Controlling and Sharing Instantly From Smartphones and Tablets".  I bought this camera with the hope to use the remote function for my Windows phone and Tablet, but it is now useless; therefore, I took off 2 stars because the useless function, and Panasonic's dishonesty.  I e-mailed Panasonic Customer Support about this problem, and they responded that I should send a letter to their Panasonic Coordination Office.  This is really ridiculous; they didn't do their jobs at all, but playing the kick-ball game.

Reviews.Title: Really great camera
Reviews.Author: Martin Slonka
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot. I admit that I haven't fully utilized every feature yet, but I've played around with different still-camera modes, as well as the video function.The main reasons for 4 stars and not 5 are minor. First, the audio quality from the top mounted stereo microphones is good, but overly compressed in loud settings. It's good because you get good clarity without distortion, but not so good because it doesn't provide an accurate mix of the audio. I've used it mainly in loud music venues, and that's where my experience comes from.Another little ding against this camera comes because of the proprietary USB connector. Really?? Why not go with a micro-USB like everybody else?? And I wish the battery charger was one-piece that plugs directly into the outlet like Canon's, instead of having a long, detachable cable that I can lose now.Otherwise the various still modes are really cool. Lots of great effects (fish-eye, sepia, B&W;, and many more!). Lots of great modes (panoramic, fast motion, best-face, best-shot, etc etc...)I haven't tested it under water or in dirty/muddy/dusty conditions yet. I'll try to update this review when I do.

Reviews.Title: exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Timothy D Wolford Sr.
Reviews.Content: pictures are so clear and the shake feature is awsome. The underwater photos came out better than expected. So easy to use and down load photos.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: dutch
Reviews.Content: Exactly what is needed for the dusty and wild Africa where it will be used. It will be dust proofed and so rugged which will be great.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Trystan
Reviews.Content: Takes good photos and the best thing for me was the remote control using an Android Phone. I can put it on the tripe and contro everything (even see the camera screen in my phone) remotelly. Good to take family pictures !

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Hani Fahmi
Reviews.Content: Picture is very clear, easy to use, setup was also easy, GPS was very handy and concatenation to inter net took some time.

Reviews.Title: Geocode broke
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "pvmiii"
Reviews.Content: I have not, as far as I can remember, ever written an Amazon review. The failure of this camera has prompted me to do so. That alone should tell you something.First, be forewarned that movies take with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5 are split up into multiple files in multiple folders on the memory chip. That means no file that is easy to move around and, in my case, it does not import into iPhoto, as a single .mov file does, so that with this camera I cannot keep all the photos and movies from a single hike in one place together. Okay, I'll just shoot my hike videos on my iPhone. Pain in the a** having to use two devices, but it's a viable work-around.Worse yet -- and this is a real deal killer -- the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5 randomly borks a photo's geocode such that the lat & long are set to some impossible to interpret value such as 17056881.853375 , where the lat should be some valid value like 33.237572 , while the long is some valid value like -111.131239 . The wierd part is, it is not consistent. Sometimes the geocode is good, but most of the time it is garbage. Now, my iPhone ocassionally throws a photo's geocode off by a half mile, but it *never* munges a geocode so completely it is impossible to interpret. For someone who does *a lot* of hiking, and likes to tie his photos to specific locations on a map, the screwed up geocodes render my brand new ~$250 Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5 worthless.

Reviews.Title: cameras
Reviews.Author: larry wimberley
Reviews.Content: i had a panasonic lumix 16xfull hd,i walked into a swimming pool in cabo with it,its shot,i loved the camera.i bought this one just in case it happens again,it takes really nice pics,dont know if its waterproof yet...

Reviews.Title: Too complicated
Reviews.Author: Bear
Reviews.Content: Have to go through too many steps when turned on before you can take photo.  Too difficult to use WiFi to transfer images to ipad etc.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the hiker
Reviews.Author: D. L. Fleming
Reviews.Content: First of all, as for all of the negative reviews complaining about the video, OK, BUT THIS NOT PRIMARILY A VIDEO CAMERA!  I have progressively owned the various improved models of the TS series camera.  I find currently have both the TS4 and TS5.  I am an avid hiker that finds myself sometimes wading or swimming accross streams. This is a fantastic camera for an active outdoor person. I can carry this in my pocket and quickly pull it out for that quick nature shot.  I am never worried about dropping the camera and having it break.I have tried several waterproof cameras over the years and have always come back to the Lumix.  They are rugged, and most of all seem to have the strongest water tight integrity (never had on leak yet).  For those complaining about the charger, I have two chargers I bought through Amazon that have the power prongs built in.  So all you have to do is look.

Reviews.Title: Great video, good quality camera
Reviews.Author: Joshua D. Smith
Reviews.Content: The video on this camera is amazing! I play handball and used it to record one of my games.  Typically it is hard to see the ball on video but this camera produced very detailed and clean video.  Picture taking is easy on automatic mode.  The menus were fairly easy to navigate.  The HDR setting was laughable and picture degrades fast when using zoom.  I would prefer more manual controls on the camera as some were limited.  The multiple shot feature is nice but would prefer longer intervals between shots or at least the option to change it for specific shooting.  The WIFI was somewhat difficult to setup as I don't have a NFS enabled phone.  I look forward to upgrading my phone so I can "tap" the two devices to pair.  The remote shooting was easy once set up and will be useful for tripod setup.  Haven't had a chance to get it wet yet but will in Hawaii for my honeymoon in October!

Reviews.Title: 29 minute limit on videos
Reviews.Author: A. SOROUDI "vball"
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if Amazon accidently shipped me an EU unit instead of a US model. The camera has a hard coded 29 minute limit for video recording (in the firmware). All compact cameras in the EU have this limitation due to taxes, however, US models should only be limited by memory card size & battery life. After the 29m limit, the video simply stops (doesn't even start a new 29m video). Can't be used for hands off recording of anything.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Milli Goodman
Reviews.Content: I have not tried it underwater yet, but feel confident it will perform well. I am taking it on my Grand Canyon raft trip July 19-24.

Reviews.Title: LUMIX DMC-FT5(TS5) for Best Rugged Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: [...]I just want to tell you about the CONS:1, Poorly display on back screen (Nikon AW110 and TG-2 are much better)2, 5 cm macroshot is not close enough (comparing with 1 cm on Nikon AW110)Others are fine. Never comparing a tough camera with DSLR, and don't expect too much, It's just a Touch Camera.I take 1 star because the 2 major cons.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera, Terrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Travis Hostetter "Gunner43"
Reviews.Content: I own an older version of this camera that I paid $400 for on Amazon.  I used the camera lightly and after just one month of sparing usage, the camera broke and took in water.  I never went below the depth prescribed nor kept the camera in the water for more than a few minutes.  Panasonic was incredibly difficult to get ahold of on the phone and when I did, they were not helpful.  I eventually found a form to fill out online and sent it with the camera back to Panasonic.  After many months, they finally sent me a replacement used camera.  However, the very next time I used it, it broke.  Now Panasonic has refused to repair the camera I sent to them and I am out $400.Terrible customer service, poor picture and video quality, and it is certainly not waterproof.  DO NOT BUY!

Reviews.Title: I have problem with my camera
Reviews.Author: Angelica
Reviews.Content: The problem during the underwater imaging depth 25 centimeter i shot the boys while playing on the surface of the waterNote i go with all the instructions in the user manual guidewayType of problem, do not take off cameras during operation only hear the beep soundhas been cleaned with a cloth after rinsing with water tortured and left it for a whole day and still the problem remans
